required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Music on Surgical Skill in the Setting of Simulated Intraocular Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Music on Surgical Skill in the Setting of Simulated Intraocular Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: Music is commonly heard in operating room. The goal of this study is to measure the effect of music on surgical performance using a intraocular surgery simulator. The music chosen is Sonata for 2 pianos D-440 from Mozart. The participants will complete 2 tasks on the simulator, both with and without music, in a randomized sequence. The results will be subtracted from the simulator and analyzed.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed up to 12 weeks after randomization
primary_outcome.description: The participants will perform tasks on a simulator on three separate days. The outcome will be measured at each of these visits.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed up to 12 weeks after randomization
secondary_outcome.description: The participants will perform tasks on a simulator on three separate days. The outcome will be measured at each of these visits.

arm_group.description: The participants in this groups will have to complete the tasks on the intraocular surgery simulator while listening to Mozart's sonata for 2 pianos in D-440
The participants in this groups will have to complete the tasks on the intraocular surgery simulator in silence

intervention.intervention_name: Music - Mozart's sonata for 2 pianos in D-440

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Ophthalmology residents at Laval University
- Ophthalmologist at Centre Hospitalier Universitaire de Québec
Exclusion Criteria:

overall_official.affiliation: Centre de recherche du CHU de Québec : Université Laval

facility.name: Centre Universitaire d'Ophtalmologie, Hôpital du Saint-Sacrement, CHU de Québec
